text: Hello everyone! I'm Ashish and in my final year of undergrad physics from India. Recently got into Julia (which I love!). I'm interested in quantum computing and would love to contribute to Julia someday. :-)

elements.text: Hello everyone! I'm Ashish and in my final year of undergrad physics from India. Recently got into Julia (which I love!). I'm interested in quantum computing and would love to contribute to Julia someday. :-)

text: Where in India?  I mentored a number of people in Kerala (helped them learn Julia :nerd_face: and how to write more performant code) for a few years while I was working for a startup based in Belgium, with a satellite office in Kochi.  We still keep in touch :slightly_smiling_face:

text: <@UB7JS9CHF> Hi! I'm from Odisha but currently live in Tamil Nadu. :-)

elements.text: Hi! I'm from Odisha but currently live in Tamil Nadu. :-)

text: There are a number of good companies that are using Julia for quantum software - check out Zapata Computing (disclosure, I consult for them!) as well as QuEra (which is also here in Massachusetts, also has ties to Harvard & MIT) (IIUC <@UC6SUUPRC> works for them, you should check out the <#CGC8JJGBA|yao-dev> channel)
